text: Allan Byron Swift (September 12, 1935 – April 20, 2018), an American Emmy award–winning broadcaster and politician. He served as a member of the United States House of Representatives from 1979 to 1995. He represented the Second Congressional District of Washington as a Democrat. Swift died on April 20, 2018 in Alexandria, Virginia of pulmonary fibrosis at the age of 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * Stennis Center for Public Service profile of Al Swift * Colling, Swift & Hynes bio of Al Swift * Category:Emmy Award winners Category:1935 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from pulmonary fibrosis Category:Disease-related deaths in Virginia Category:American radio personalities Category:United States representatives from Washington Category:Politicians from Tacoma, Washington Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Al Swift
